repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Legal Department records
did.abstract: Founded in 1864 in New York, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) was one of the largest and oldest advertising agencies in the United States. In 2018 JWT merged with Wunderman to form Wunderman Thompson. The collection includes release forms, photographs and publications associated with JWT advertising campaigns; legal contracts outlining terms of agreement between clients and the agency; and other printed materials. Companies represented in the collection include Ford, Gillette, Kodak, Lever Brothers, Pacific Mills (Cocheco Manufacturing Company), Pan American , Quaker Oats, Radio Corporation of America (RCA), Seven-Up, Singer, and Uncle Ben's. Photographers mentioned or whose work appears in the collection include Richard Avedon, Ralph Bartholomew, Anton Bruehl, Horst, Otto Mayo, Valentino Sarra, and Francesco Scavullo. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Model Releases and Overscale Talent Releases may not be photocopied.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company Legal Department Records, 1936-1979, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Legal Department Records, were acquired as a gift from the J. Walter Thompson Company by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1986 and subesquent years.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection includes release forms, photographs and publications associated with JWT advertising campaigns; legal contracts outlining terms of agreement between clients and the agency; and other printed materials. Companies represented in the collection include Ford, Gillette, Kodak, Lever Brothers, Pacific Mills (Cocheco Manufacturing Company), Pan American , Quaker Oats, Radio Corporation of America (RCA), Seven-Up, Singer, and Uncle Ben's. Photographers mentioned or whose work appears in the collection include Richard Avedon, Ralph Bartholomew, Anton Bruehl, Horst, Otto Mayo, Valentino Sarra, and Francesco Scavullo.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into six series: Model Releases; Photographers; Publications; Reports; Model-Client-Date Cards; and Overscale Talent Releases.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Correspondence, mundane visuals and releases, and advertisements were removed from the collection. The advertisements were relocated in RG 10 Proof Collection. Drafts of the releases and correspondence pertaining to the releases have been removed from the collection. [Per JWT Archivist notes prior to the transfer of records to Duke University.]

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections of the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives:

extref.emph: Sidney Ralph Bernstein Company History Files

Advertising -- Photographers
controlaccess.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of photographs and photostats of models as they often appeared in an advertisement. Attached to the images is a signed release by the model. The model releases are arranged alphabetically by client and then by model and date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains photographs and photostats of models as they often appeared in advertisements. Attached to these images are signed releases by models. Items are arranged alphabetically by photographer and then by client and date.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains an assortment of publications which required model releases, and especially Ford newsletters from the 1950s. The materials are arranged alphabetically by client and then by the name of the publication and date.

did.unittitle: March...March...March...The Fifth Year of the March, 1959-1960

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of two folders relating to JWT clients Pacific Mills and Kodak. The Pacific Mills folder contains files related to the introduction of contour sheets from the years 1949-1953. The Kodak folder details a marketing consideration from 1970. The folders were arranged alphabetically by client.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series includes three black boxes with index cards of models used by the various clients. Items are arranged alphabetically by model in the first two boxes and by client (Kodak only) in the third box.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes routine legal contracts which list the terms of agreement between the client, talent and the J. Walter Thompson Company. They specify the length of the contract, the client and the date. The bulk of the contracts are in their original format and therefore have actual signatures of the talent. Overscale refers to the fact that these contracts remunerated above normal union scale wages.
